column3:
total number of rows for specified boundary 
value nudging; only for real-data cases

number of points in specified zone when
specified=.true.; only for real-data cases

number of points in relaxation zone when
specified=.true.; only for real-data cases

exponential multiplier for relaxation zone 
ramp when specified=.true.; 0 = linear ramp; 
0.33 = ~3*DX exp decay factor; only for
real-data cases

set to =.true. to instruct real.exe to generate
multiple wrfbdy files (one time period per 
file, using bdy_inname=wrfbdy_d01_<date>)

set to =.true. to use periodic boundary 
conditions in the x-direction

set to =.true. to use symmetric boundary 
conditions on the x start side (west side)

set to =.true. to use symmetric boundary 
conditions on the x end side (east side)

set to =.true. to use open boundary 
conditions on the x start side (west side)

set to =.true. to use open boundary 
conditions on the x end side (east side)

set to =.true. to use periodic boundary 
conditions in the y-direction

set to =.true. to use symmetric boundary 
conditions on the y start side (south side)

set to =.true. to use symmetric boundary 
conditions on the y end side (north side)

set to =.true. to use open boundary 
conditions on the y start side (south side)

set to =.true. to use open boundary 
conditions on the y end side (north side)

set to =.true. to use nested boundary 
conditions; must be set to .true. for nests

set to =.true. to use a constant boundary 
condition; for dfi_opt>0

set to =.true. to use the microphysics 
variables from the wrfbdy file in wrf.exe
after running ndown

set to =.true. to use scalar variables from 
the wrfbdy file in wrf.exe after running 
ndown
